name: Equity Disclosure
author: Ian/Vayne

sections.description:
Administrator of the Blog enters in information regarding the companies they, and all their blog writers have any interest, such as being a director or officer of the firm, holding 10 percent or more equity, or owning public stock. This is performed through the Administrator Dashboard, Equity Disclosure menu. The companies may be added and deleted at will, and are stored locally in the WordPress database, custom table disclosures. Then the administrator must place this widget in the sidebar. The blog writers’ equity information will appear on the widget placement.

Feature List

  1. Add unlimited company names and stock tickers
  2. Displays information in every footer section of every blog page, so make sure to place the EquityDisclosure widget in the footer section
sections.installation:
1. Rename and Upload the EquityDisclosure.zip file to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory and unzip with the file structure intact. This should create an EquityDisclosure folder with all the proper files and additional directory structure.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
Where is this information stored, and does it go out to any servers to send or retrieve information?

All information is stored locally in your WordPress database, and all activities are local to your server, meaning, the server does not send or receive data.
